recHYXHqb8LY3DGsJ.name: Arken: Runic Raids
recHYXHqb8LY3DGsJ.shortDescription: Rune is an addicting dark fantasy RPG. Play and earn runes (crypto) battling players and AI. Use runes to craft gear (NFTs) to make your character more powerful.
recHYXHqb8LY3DGsJ.description:
The Future DeFi and Gaming Ecosystem

Hybrid gaming ecosystem which utilizes NFT game assets, seamless integration into a conventional game.
recHYXHqb8LY3DGsJ.cmcDescription:
## What Is Rune (RUNE)?

[Rune](https://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/rune/) is an open-ended dark fantasy gaming universe built on [Binance Smart Chain](https://coinmarketcap.com/alexandria/article/what-is-binance-smart-chain), where players can battle, join a guild, collect powerful weapons, and earn [NFTs](https://coinmarketcap.com/alexandria/glossary/non-fungible-token) and cryptocurrency in the form of runes by playing.

Runes are small and rare stones inscribed with magical glyphs needed to craft Runewords (NFTs), weapons, and armor. 33 different Runes are distributed to players over two years. Each Rune has a supply of 100,000 or less, and players can earn Runes by competing against other players, joining guilds, participating in yield farms, and community participation.

The Rune universe consists of Arken: Evolution Isles, a play-to-earn game, Arken: Runic Raids, the yield farm, Runewords (NFTs), and the Arken: Infinite Arena Arena, a player-versus-player game. The team is also developing the Arken: Heart of the Oasis, an MMORPG that will be launched in 2022. Currently, Rune is running on BSC, but the team sees the universe as blockchain-agnostic and is building a bridge to [Polygon](https://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/polygon/).

## Who Are the Founders of Rune?

Rune’s founders are anonymous. The team chose to stay anonymous to protect itself, its associates, and users from “archaic legislation imposed by governments who won’t understand the emerging DeFi field for years to come.” The team alludes to “Binzy,” which is their fill-in for the person(s) behind Rune, a real software engineer with 20 years of experience and connections in the crypto world.
In total, the team consists of 12 people: the lead dev, four unity developers, a React developer, a Solidity developer, two consultant developers, two consultant project managers, one marketing manager, one community manager, four mods and some advisors.

## What Makes Rune Unique?

Rune offers an attractive mix of blockchain gaming, NFTs, and elements from decentralized finance. Its universe is split into four different parts.

Arken: Evolution Isles is a play-to-earn game and was the first game built for the ecosystem. You start as a dragonling that can fly around and eat sprites to evolve into a dragon eventually. One round in the web browser-based game lasts five minutes, and players can earn crypto as a reward.

Arken: Runic Raids is the yield farm that attracts liquidity to the ecosystem. You can acquire runes through providing liquidity and raiding farms, i.e., yield farming. The team promises that since the supply of runes is limited, their price should find a bottom. Moreover, each rune has its specific utility, and runes can also be combined to build Runewords. Furthermore, for 2022, an online RPG built around runes is in development.

Runewords (NFTs) are unique weapons and armor. Each Runeword is suitable for a specific hero class (seven different hero classes exist) or style of play. Runewords improve a hero’s capabilities in battle and offer improved farming and merchant abilities. Runewords are shared, collected, and traded in the Arken Market and players will soon be able to lend them to others. Runewords are crafted from runes.

Finally, the Arken: Infinite Arena Arena is a player-versus-player, web-based 2D topdown game, where you battle your opponents for prizes. Once you defeat an opponent, they go back to the beginning while you can continue the path that goes on infinitely. The last one standing after one minute of battle claims a reward in the form of crypto or NFTs. Every 15 minutes, you enter a new arena.

recliyliDEtDvPAXj.name: Arken: Evolution Isles
recliyliDEtDvPAXj.description: Arken: Evolution Isles is a web-based arena style game, comprised of 10+ game modes rotating every 5 minutes. You collect sprites to evolve your character to be able to beat other players, while trying to collect rewards scattered on the map. Each game mode puts a spin on the game play. Although it's easy to get started, the battle for glory is more difficult. It currently has 5+ servers covering the world.
recliyliDEtDvPAXj.storyline: You start a dragonling, new to the vibrant Mage Isles, in a world of might and magic. The isles are a dangerous place for a youngling, and you constantly need to flee to safety. Until one day, suddenly, you evolve, and find new strength to conquer your foes.

recFdy48Ir2f75dAI.name: Arken: Infinite Arena
recFdy48Ir2f75dAI.description: Crush opponents while earning unique prizes in this fast-paced fantasy PvP brawler from Rune: a world-renowned crypto gaming company pushing NFT games to new horizons. Choose your class, customize your avatar, and collect unique NFTs playing the third game in Rune’s ever-expanding metaverse. Test your mettle against players across the globe and rise above the rest as Champion of the Infinite Arena.

recmnIkddjmEnA2V0.name: Arken: Guardians Unleashed
recmnIkddjmEnA2V0.description: Hatch unique pets, unlock special abilities, and raise your perfect Guardian in the newest digital pet NFT game from Rune. Grow and evolve your pets as you fight alongside them in Rune’s expanding metaverse: from the Infinite Arena PvP brawler to the vast RPG of Sanctuary. With over 50 unique pet designs and nearly a trillion combinations: breed an epic companion that’s unique to you! Earn new and exclusive recipes, rewards, and abilities as you progress in this constantly evolving game, seamlessly integrated into Rune’s flourishing ecosystem.

recWcz2wmZA77hYrk.name: Arken: Heart of the Oasis
recWcz2wmZA77hYrk.description: With the power of the Arkencube in your hands, you are tasked with saving Haerra from inevitable destruction. Immerse yourself in Rune’s groundbreaking fantasy RPG as you customize your unique character and class, craft unique NFTs, and rise against the forces which seek to overwhelm Haerra. In Sanctuary, every choice you make has consequences. Do you have what it takes to save your world, or will you fall to ruin at the feet of the gods?

reci6117DNFmvidls.name: Introduction
reci6117DNFmvidls.text: Rune: Infinite is a 2D Arena Brawler, the third game in the Rune ecosystem. The game demonstrates the seamless integration of NFT items into skill-based PvP gameplay and provides players with an exhilarating and challenging experience.

recwto2jjdQAl72Ja.name: Game Description
recwto2jjdQAl72Ja.text:
**Game Objective**

Defeat a continuous stream of player opponents in skill-based gameplay to earn prizes.

recD3iKe7GwdCUTba.name: Game Description
recD3iKe7GwdCUTba.text:
**Gameplay**

Infinite is a 2D player-vs-player (PvP) arena brawler. Play as a humanoid avatar, your hero, outfitted with a set of equipment that can be earned or crafted. 
All players have standard attack, defense, and movement. However, your equipment choices decide your hero’s capabilities. In addition to changing your character’s standard attack animation and defense efficacy, the equipment act as cards to a deck, allowing players to choose attack, movement and utility skills and skill mods to produce a large number of unique and interesting builds.
Players can use a keyboard and mouse, or controller, to move their character, attack, and use skills.
Levels are arena style that offer players room to maneuver but encourage constant engagement. They also offer dynamic challenges and obstacles.

recBa9FSOu61J728p.name: Game Description
recBa9FSOu61J728p.text:
## Features
High level features:
- Player-vs-player (PvP) combat
- Eternal Tournaments
    - Random map selection
    - Rewards
- Item (NFT) Integration
    - Skills and skill modifications
        - Synergies
    - Classes
    - Passive attributes
- Online networking
Additional features:
- Spectator mode
- Game options
- Login system (using Web3 wallet)
- Targeting system
- Leaderboards
- Replays
Potential features:
- Roguelite map generation
- Larger-scale combat: Up to 4v4 or 8-player free-for-all
- In-game art for all items
- Achievements
- Customizable Avatars

recZfMTVkWKyFHzGj.name: Technical
recZfMTVkWKyFHzGj.text:
## Framework
Infinite is being built using Unity (2020.3.8f1).
## Platform Support
Android (version 10 or higher)
Iphone (version 9 or higher)
Windows (version 10 or higher)
Mac (version 11 or higher)
Web (Brave, Chrome, Edge, Firefox)
Ipad + Other Tablets (version 9 or higher)

recD8pCOauqcgP2n6.name: Story
recD8pCOauqcgP2n6.text:
Arken: Infinite Arena is part of the Arken Realms. The Infinite Arena exists at the End of Time, a nexus where the fabric of causality loses any semblance of structure or temporal order. Within the End of Time, all points in time are accessible and sometimes interconnected or overlapping. The Infinite Arena is an anomaly where the greatest warriors across time and space are locked in an endless cycle of successive battles from a variety of locales and eras. You are one of these warriors, driven by some inscrutable force to test your mettle in the Arena, seeking ever greater power and prizes.
The Infinite Arena is embedded in the legends of some of Rune’s culture, and the exploits of warriors within it will be echoed in Sanctuary (MMORPG).

recUeyZYF2KvgxFJm.name: Art Direction
recUeyZYF2KvgxFJm.text: The art style for Rune is a bright world that pops and catches attention while remaining somewhat realistic, rather than cartoony. We feel this will capture an audience that isn’t interested in the gritty dark fantasy theme. We are avoiding the repetition present in a lot of classic RPGs in repeated textures. An example of a game that did this well was Secret of Evermore. Objects within the game are scaled in a realistic manner. We don’t want to pigeonhole ourselves into only using 16 x 16 tiles or 32 x 32 tiles to make everything, so objects should be sized appropriately.

recaBOYZYzYtIlxmw.name: Levels
recaBOYZYzYtIlxmw.text:
There is a predefined set of levels that showcase different locations within the Rune Universe. These levels are chosen at random to become the site for PvP duels, and will be structured to offer dynamic challenges to players. 

## Mage Isles – Castle Ruins
Players will find themselves within an abandoned, overgrown castle on a floating island. Though abandoned, and damaged, the castle exhibits little in the way of time-based wear. Thick foliage has found a way to thrive without intervention. Fallen stone and fenced pathways offer bottlenecks for strategically-minded players.
 

## Obsidian City Overlook
Players will duel on the rim of a volcano, with the Obsidian City, the demon capital, as their backdrop. The terrain stands in stark contrast to the mystical beauty of the mage isles: Harsh, dark and jagged rock faces with little vegetation. Streams of lava will act as environmental hazards. This map offers buffs to players who use the fire element.
 

## Fayhelm Forest
Players engage in combat amidst a druid village positioned high amidst the trees’ canopies, with the forest floor visible far below. Small areas that act as fall traps will be placed throughout the map, allowing players to strategically push enemies to their doom. The druidic presence in the forest will see players who wield the power of nature have greater efficacy.

rec6WxFc3dZqX3Kgh.name: Game Mechanics
rec6WxFc3dZqX3Kgh.text:
## PvP Combat
Arken: Infinite Arena will be centered around competitive action gameplay. Players win by reducing their opponents’ health to 0 (as well as maintain their own) using skills provided to them from their equipment. 
Players will be able to attack each other using melee, ranged, and spellcasting abilities. They will be able to dodge incoming attacks using a variety of movement skills, nullify damage with defensive skills, and apply buffs/debuffs and regenerate through utility skills.
After each round, players are rewarded for their performance, and the winner will move on for a chance at even greater prizes. Players will be able to choose 1v1 or 2v2 matches, entering the associated tournament brackets.

## Eternal Tournament
A key component of Infinite’s underlying match structure is the creation of an endless cycle of tournaments. Tournament brackets are constructed based on the number of active players. Victorious players move on to the next round until a final duel, after which the tournament will reset. Players who lose, or who join too late, compete in other similarly generated tournaments or one-off matches. The larger the tournament, the greater the rewards for winning. 
Players who leave after winning a match in an incomplete tournament have a set period of time to return to a game before forfeiting a game. If they rejoin later but their opponent is unavailable, the player-specific deadline changes to a round-specific deadline. If neither player is present at the deadline, both players will forfeit and the player who would have faced the winner will pass to the next round.

recUbgQAAVL6Dfz5C.name: Game Mechanics
recUbgQAAVL6Dfz5C.text:
**Scaling Rewards**
Competing in Infinite’s tournaments and one-off matches earn players rewards. Successive victories in a tournament will increase the chances of rewards of higher rarity/value. For example, reaching the final brackets of a large tournament will give players rolls in the “Elite” tier, giving them a chance of receiving NFT items that are specifically rewarded for tournament play and not craftable. Losing early, however, will only provide a selection of BEP-20 Rune tokens.

Possible item rewards/tiers:
- Champion Tier – Unique NFT Items, BEP-20 Runes, $RUNE token, Rune Guardian pets
- Elite Tier – Unique NFT Items, BEP-20 Runes
- Competitor Tier – NFT items, BEP-20 Runes
- Participant Tier – BEP-20 Runes

reciR7IuKeFTBiUt5.name: Game Mechanics
reciR7IuKeFTBiUt5.text:
**Randomized Map Selection**
Battles occur across multiple maps, displaying different settings in the Rune universe. A random sampling of these maps occurs when a tournament generates the brackets, and every player in the tournament is likely to experience a different set of maps on their way to the final. Maps will contain environmental hazards and obstacles, requiring players to adjust their strategies accordingly.

recK97Nef3lh5dIPl.name: Game Mechanics
recK97Nef3lh5dIPl.text:
## NFT Item Integration
Each players’ build and play style are determined by their equipped NFT items (_Runewords_), which confer **skills**,** skill mods**,** skill points **and **passive attribute bonuses/penalties**.
**Like a card game, **items will provide interesting opportunities for **synergies**, extended combos, situational moments of brilliance.

rec1rlcFjSEDYjpB9.name: Game Mechanics
rec1rlcFjSEDYjpB9.text:
### **Skills**
Players have access to:
- Up to 2 attack skills
- Up to 4 utility (defense, buff, debuff) skills
- 1 Ultra skill
- 1 Movement skill
Skills are given by specific inventory slots
- Attack Skills: Weapons
- Utility Skills: Shield, Helm, Chest, Amulets
- Movement Skills: Boots

 **Skill Mods & Skill Points**
- **Modifications** give special buffs when used with a specific skill but can be used for other skills in the same category for a more general effect.
- **Skill points** are spendable on a skill tree, could be seen as increasing a skill’s level or providing more generalized passive benefits (+attack speed, cooldown reduction, etc.)


Skill mods/skill points can be given by these slots
- Attack mods: Rings, Gloves, Bracers, Off-hand weapons
- Utility mods: Rings, Amulets, Belts
- Movement mods: Rings, Pants, Belts, Boots
- Skill points: Rings, Gloves, Bracers, Pants, Belts
 
This gives lots of build freedom- either build wide with lots of skills, or build narrow with few skills that are maxed out and buffed.

rectclzZmoqtoD2ox.name: Game Mechanics
rectclzZmoqtoD2ox.text:
**Attack skills**
Basic attack and attack skills determined by weapon(s), e.g.:
- Guiding Light
    - Normal attack: Slash Combo (Melee; shared w/ all greatswords)
    - Attack Skill - Moonlight Wave – Horizontal slash that produces a projectile. Enemies caught in melee have a chance to be carried back and staggered by the projectile.
    - Subclass Affinity: Open

- Wrath
- Normal: Flurry of Blows (Melee; claws)
- Attack Skill: Afterimage Assault - Player dashes forward, and upon contacting an enemy produces an afterimage in front of them, teleporting behind and dealing a series of melee attacks that deal additional rending damage with a high critical damage rate.
- Subclass Affinity: Mirage Dancer

- Grace
- Normal: Quick Shots (Bows)
- Attack Skill: Hidden Shot - Player fires a slow-moving, invisible projectile that curves toward the enemy player. Projectile appears after passing through 50% of the distance between player and target
- Subclass Affinity: Scout
Fighting with two weapons defaults to the dominant hand’s normal attack progression, increasing attack speed & combo length but reducing damage given by each attack. Wearing two weapons or a two-handed weapon will greatly reduce the efficacy of standard blocking.

**Attack skill mods** given by **gloves**,** rings** and **bracers**, e.g.:
- Smoke (Gloves): 
- (Specific) Afterimage Assault: Attacks and spells pass through you during after-image assault, but you deal less damage.
- (General) Melee Attack Skills: Reduce the chance of your skill being interrupted by taking damage. 
- Zeal (Bracers):
    - (Specific) Moonlight Torrent: Chance to stun, target is pulled x meters toward you, shorter range. 
    - (General) Ranged attack skills: Chance to stop target movement for 3s, shorter range.

rec5WwHaPlAXITiAM.name: Game Mechanics
rec5WwHaPlAXITiAM.text:
**Movement skills **
Three basic skills (roll, dash, blink) determined by boots. Boots sometimes contain mods, e.g.:
- Flash:
- Movement skill: Dash
- Mod - Static trail – Each dash drops an orb of electricity, which chain lightning between each other after a few seconds.
- Hush:
    - Movement skill: Blink
        - Mod – Shadow Step – Player becomes momentarily invisible, leaving an after-image where the blink was initiated.
- Raid:
    - Movement skill: Roll
        - Mod – Ceaseless Offense – Player swings their weapon while rolling, dealing 50% normal damage.

recbZWpCiZ4VNQlpB.name: Game Mechanics
recbZWpCiZ4VNQlpB.text:
**Utility Skills **
Utility skills provide an additional layer of gameplay versatility. They might be passive or active, things like self-buffs/auras/projectile shields. Would follow the same principles as attack skills. Passive buffs may reduce the amount of mana/stamina a player has for using other skills.
e.g.:
- Hellfire (Chest Armor):
- Utility Skill: (Passive) Avatar of Fire – Normal attacks have 50% of their damage exchanged for fire damage. Fire resistance +20%, Fire absorption +5%. Earth resistance -20%.
- Fortress (Shield):
    - Utility skill: (Active) Sanctuary – Erects a projectile shield in a circle that follows the player and heals. If an opposing player is within the radius, they are tossed back and receive damage.

recMBDIBOdGo2hoKc.name: Game Mechanics
recMBDIBOdGo2hoKc.text:
**Classes**
- Class determined by character NFT, changes arrangement of skill tree and the available passive buffs.
- Subclass determined by affinity, which is determined by skills, mods, skill points and their placement in a skill tree. See below picture.
- Some skills/mods require a primary class, or subclass affinity. 
- i.e., you can place or equip them, but they will not be active unless your loadout’s affinity matches the prerequisite.
- Not all skills/mods give inherent subclass affinity but placing them on your skill tree in certain positions will.

recZDQAtrgyFF9Fhw.name: Synergies
recZDQAtrgyFF9Fhw.text:
Some skills offer situational _synergies_. In other words, they have enhanced effects if cast under certain circumstances, or only available to cast after requirements have been met. 
E.g.
- **Bewildering Meteor: **
- Calls down a meteor on the enemy player that deals considerable fire damage and leaves behind fire walls. Available only if the player has recently deflected a spell and landed three successive fireballs.
- **Moonlight Torrent (Moonlight Wave+): **
    - Moonlight wave’s range reduces, but at its range limit the projectile explodes into an arcane river-like effect that carries the (potentially staggered) enemy back toward the user. If this combo successfully hits and the enemy is staggered, using Moonlight Torrent again will produce a downward vertical slash that causes the ground to erupt with arcane energy. Only available if an enemy is staggered at the end of a combo, the user’s health is below 30%, and they have won 100 matches with Guiding Light equipped.

**Passive Attributes**
Passive attributes apply without player intervention, selectively modifying certain in-game parameters.
- Modifiers to attack speed, damage, critical hit chance, etc.
- Damage types, such as fire, poison, ice, and corresponding ailments. 
    - Defensive counterparts: Resistance, reflect, absorb-as-hp or absorb-as-mana.
- Some items include cast-on attributes, e.g. “10% chance to cast a Frost Nova when hit with a melee attack” or “10% chance to summon a Blood Golem when you receive the bleeding ailment”.
- Some attributes will involve achieving some goal, e.g. “Win 10 consecutive matches” or “Win 50 perfect victories”, to:
    - Unlock an attribute/multiple attributes/a skill/a special synergy
    - Turn an attribute from a negative (fire weakness) to a positive (fire resist)
    - “Rank up” an attribute
- Special ailments: e.g., Sacrifice, which increases reward with each successive victory but applies greater debuffs as well (randomized after every round).

recLADkbkwvx5S4Qo.name: Online Networking
recLADkbkwvx5S4Qo.text:
The game is built for a web browser, utilizing WebGL. The website uses an API to connect to the Node.js server and proxy events to the Unity client. The Unity client sends events back to the browser when the user takes actions, and forwards those to the server. 

The API will be integrated directly into the Unity project, allowing us to distribute desktop and mobile applications, while using the existing event infrastructure and supporting web in parallel.

Current regions:

- Asia
- Europe
- Oceanic
- North America
- South America

Each server acts as a coordinator that forwards your connection to the game server, where you play the round. At some point the coordinator may tell the client to switch to a different game server on the next round. This allows us to scale the servers.




_Choosing your server from the global list_

The login system requires a cryptographic signature to authenticate the user. Before you start executing moderator actions, you must sign a message and provide that to the game server. This system will also be utilized for player logins.

rec4CHiF3hrKErT9K.name: Game Description
rec4CHiF3hrKErT9K.text:
# **Game Description**
# 
## Game Objective
The goal of the game is to consume energy, evolve, and vanquish your foes for prizes. 

## Gameplay
You play as a creature. You control the movement of that creature using your mouse, or WASD, or joystick on mobile. You lose health persistently. You must navigate to consume sprites, replenishing your health. If you lose all of your health, you die and must restart, however you keep your points for that round. If you max your health, you evolve into the next evolution (if possible). If you navigate on top of an opposing player and you are more evolved, you do damage to them. If you are less evolved, they do damage to you. If you are the same evolution, nothing happens. This continues until the round ends. Each round is 5 minutes.

## Features
High level features:
- Character evolution
- Point collection
- Online networking
- PvP combat
- PvP rounds
- Game modes
Additional features:
- Minimap
- Game options
- Login system (using Web3 wallet)
- Targeting system
- Spawn bubble
- Lag debuff
- Replays
These are features we’re thinking about:
- Skins
- Teams
- Capture The Flag

recSMeAaP5YO7bwIq.name: Technical
recSMeAaP5YO7bwIq.text:
**Framework**
Evolution is built using Unity (2020.3.8f1).

## Platform Support
Android (version 10 or higher)
iPhone (version 9 or higher)
Windows (version 10 or higher)
Mac (version 11 or higher)
Web (Brave, Chrome, Edge, Firefox)
