attributes.description: {parameter1} to avoid losing points on death.

attributes.name: KilledPlayerPenaltyIncrease
attributes.description: {parameter1} greater point penalty for defeated opponents.

reca7HhAcevueLphe.name: Guiding Light
reca7HhAcevueLphe.lore1: Although for the most part druids are a peaceful people, this is not universally true. Long ago, when the druids and elves warred over the Faytree and Skytree, a druid named Caietus forged a powerful greatsword with pure moonlight, enabling Caietus to cut through the elves' ranks like grass and win the Faytree for the druids.
reca7HhAcevueLphe.description: Forged for the great druid warrior Caietus in the war against elves, the now peaceful people have little need for it.
reca7HhAcevueLphe.visualDescription: A large sword with a handguard of blackwood and silver gilding, and a long blade of shimmering white metal and light.

rec9GGvO5KXhqzUXr.name: Lionheart
rec9GGvO5KXhqzUXr.lore1: Lionheart once belonged to a paladin named Idaro Tolspier, who broke his oaths and turned against the Paladins. Even after he fell at the Battle of Acid Gate, the name of this blade was stained with blood for nearly a century. Since its repossession by the Knights Templar of Linden, it has been passed down from Templar War Leader to War Leader.
rec9GGvO5KXhqzUXr.description: Taken from a paladin whose fall from grace was legendary, the glow of this weapon's blade promises courage and strength to its wielder.
rec9GGvO5KXhqzUXr.visualDescription: Lionheart is emblazoned with the sun symbol of Relia, and along with being a deadly and imposing weapon, it equips the wearer with undaunting courage and strength.

attributes.description: {parameter1} Yield Bonus, Sent To Guild Treasury

attributes.name: TokenFindWin
attributes.description: {parameter1} chance to find a guild token on win

recGIe6l6pU3MqnKR.name: Pressure
recGIe6l6pU3MqnKR.lore1: Although the origin of these gauntlets are largely unknown, some claim the blue metal was created by a Kilran alchemist who promptly lost the recipe. The same metal is only found in one other place: on greaves known as Flash. Since its creation, it found its way to the Archons, who fused it with seething astra energy.
recGIe6l6pU3MqnKR.description: Masterfully crafted from an otherworldly blue metal and infused with astra energy, these gauntlets brim with untapped power.
recGIe6l6pU3MqnKR.visualDescription: Forged from a mysterious blue metal, these ornate gauntlets are outfitted with gold gilding and enchanted with potent astra energy.

recYcT2N1b6aSH0wW.name: Zeal
recYcT2N1b6aSH0wW.lore1: Although the Templar lord Arjun Gallick claims to have found these gauntlets near the northern Templar fortress of Blackrock Castle, some speculate that they were purchased from a black market in Vtello.
recYcT2N1b6aSH0wW.description: While elegant on the exterior, these bracers drive the wearer to a barbarian-like frenzy when first entering battle.
recYcT2N1b6aSH0wW.visualDescription: Forged from a shimmering silver metal alloy, these bracers are inlain with weaved lines of bronze, gold, and copper.

recPFHX2silywKoph.name: Balance
recPFHX2silywKoph.lore1: An elven relic of old, this belt has been passed down from generation to generation. Its exact origin is unknown, however the now-extinct greatwyrms were known to have terrorized Fayhelm centuries before.
recPFHX2silywKoph.description: This wyrmhide belt is made from the hide of an ancient greatwyrm, and affords the wearer significant power.
recPFHX2silywKoph.visualDescription: Skillfully shaped from soft yet resilient wyrmhide, this rust-brown belt remains in perfect shape despite its age.

recfIhHv29Epczj9w.name: Beacon
recfIhHv29Epczj9w.lore1: Theorized to be some form of cracked worldstone shard, the amulet can't be inspected closely enough to know for sure. This amulet belonged to the royalty of Samyrah before it vanished without resurfacing.
recfIhHv29Epczj9w.description: The light emitted from this brilliant stone highlights the latent arcane potential of objects in the environment.
recfIhHv29Epczj9w.visualDescription: An amulet truly befitting of its name, this chain is fitted with a pulsing purple star, crackling with violent energy.

recrtriXM0DXplX9V.name: Dragonlight
recrtriXM0DXplX9V.lore1: Though its true origin is lost to time, Dragonlight was given as a gift to the Arch Prince of Kithver long ago. When the Princedom of Kithver was overthrown, this amulet vanished for centuries, until one day resurfacing in a black market of Nassau.
recrtriXM0DXplX9V.description: Infused with the breath of an ice dragon, this ancient amulet radiates a pale blue light and is searing cold to the touch.
recrtriXM0DXplX9V.visualDescription: With a platinum chain affixed to a glittering platinum dragon wrapped about a massive aquamarine, this feat of jewelry emanates a frosty aura.

recFjtiuYkil0PmXH.name: Haze
recFjtiuYkil0PmXH.lore1: Just as darkness hides the face of its wearer, the origin of Haze is masked with obscurity. With owners as vague as the item itself, little is documented about this dark hood.
recFjtiuYkil0PmXH.description: A hood of unknown origin and fabric, beneath which an unnatural darkness clouds the appearance of the wearer.
recFjtiuYkil0PmXH.visualDescription: Simple and unassuming, this hood appears like any other cloth hood on Haerra. However, while worn, an inky darkness hides the appearance of the wearer; inspiring fear in those who peer too close.

recwo8cZPde38ogHd.name: Hellfire
recwo8cZPde38ogHd.lore1: Forged by the Drocos Legion in the final, desperate hours of dragonkind, Hellfire fused the best craftsmanship of humanoids with the raw power of a dragon. Time would prove that this breastplate would not be enough to stop the slaughter of dragons, though it stands as a defiant symbol to this day.
recwo8cZPde38ogHd.description: Produced on one of the rare occasions that dragons lent their energies to crafting, this armor is always hot to the touch.
recwo8cZPde38ogHd.visualDescription: Glimmering with a silver-blue hue, one might incorrectly assume this armor to be cool to the touch. However, this intricately carved breastplate radiates heat, searing all but the wearer.

reciZLfyqJV4lhrey.name: Luminous Flywings
reciZLfyqJV4lhrey.lore1: The voracious nature of Mage Isles fauna leave the defenseless glowflies unlikely to reach maturity, a point at which their body parts are coveted for their strange magical effects. These wings are one such example, granting their owner occasional bursts of magical speed and incredible dexterity.
reciZLfyqJV4lhrey.description: Delicate and vibrant with color, these glowfly wings bestow the holder with periodic bursts of speed and agility.
reciZLfyqJV4lhrey.visualDescription: Ranging from yellow to red to pale blue, these delicate wings can be found in all manner of vibrant colors. Though not much larger than a human finger, these flywings are highly coveted by magic-users and fighters alike.

attributes.name: DeathPenaltyAvoid
attributes.description: {parameter1} to avoid losing points on death.

recp5MKyLmNfPi6SQ.name: Growth
recp5MKyLmNfPi6SQ.lore1: Though coveted by all peoples across Haerra, shields like these are created regularly amongst the druids. In addition to the incredibly time-consuming process, Growth was enchanted with druidic magic in every stage of its creation, from its sapling of birth to the final twisted knots that adorn its surface.
recp5MKyLmNfPi6SQ.description: Comparable in durability to even the strongest metals, this wooden shield was shaped and enchanted by druidic magic.
recp5MKyLmNfPi6SQ.visualDescription: Moreso grown than crafted, this beautiful ironwood shield is gnarled with knots and vines that cascade down its exterior.

recXCJQlMzF36ThjX.name: Blur
recXCJQlMzF36ThjX.lore1: An artifact of the legendary Sim’yrr’ha Drocoslanis (or “Dragonslayers of Samyrah”), this is the last survivor of the hundreds created to fight against the dragons. Imbuing the dragonslayers with incredible speed and agility, Blur aided in the death of dozens of dragons.
recXCJQlMzF36ThjX.description: Enchanted with evasive magic, even the surest of strikes have trouble finding purchase on this finely-crafted armor.
recXCJQlMzF36ThjX.visualDescription: Made more for dexterity than pure physical defense, this light armor is weaved together from silvery pauldrons to drakehide leathers and straps.

attributes.description: Must equip for {parameter1} consecutive hours to receive benefit of {parameter2}

attributes.name: DoublePickupChance
attributes.description: {parameter1} chance to double an item pickup

recaqRqL8oEADC5zQ.name: Mercy
recaqRqL8oEADC5zQ.lore1: Mercy was intended as a gift to the Aakschipper--the mythical head of the Haverak Syndicate--from the Forsaken Mancers. However, a vessel belonging to the Knights Templar of Linden intercepted the envoy and confiscated the dagger.
recaqRqL8oEADC5zQ.description: An aura of menace surrounds this dagger, its prominent serrations promising a quick and bloody end to the foes of its wielder.
recaqRqL8oEADC5zQ.visualDescription: A lethal dagger of intimidating proportions, this blade draws the ire of even the most experienced soldiers. With multiple serrated edges filing like waves along the blue-hued blade, it hurts far more coming out than going in.

attributes.description: {parameter1} Chance To Send Harvest To Hidden Pool

attributes.description: {parameter1} chance to double an item pickup

rec3HL5G2x2KItT6K.name: Edict
rec3HL5G2x2KItT6K.lore1: Beneath the cover, the first words of this tome detail its author, a Ragor Necrologist by the name of Kailan Dribor. This, however, is perhaps worth less than the means of its discovery: found sandwiched in the head of a wandering zombie, just several miles south of Westmarsh.
rec3HL5G2x2KItT6K.description: This leather-bound tome contains powerful incantations which give the bearer significant influence over the spirit world.
rec3HL5G2x2KItT6K.visualDescription: With a giant skull emblazoned on the face of this dusty leather-bound volume, the necromantic purpose of this book is all too obvious.

attributes.description: {parameter1} Chance To Send Harvest To Hidden Pool

attributes.description: {parameter1} Chance To Send Harvest To Hidden Pool

recRU6KbJBwEbl29E.name: Burial
recRU6KbJBwEbl29E.description: Faint wisps of ichor energy endlessly drift from the scythe's blade, its necromantic enchantments trivializing the process of harvesting souls.
recRU6KbJBwEbl29E.visualDescription: While not particularly pretty, this massive scythe is purely practical. A gnarled and twisted handle of shadewood is affixed to a curved blade of muted and chipped steel. The edges of the long blade froth with necrotic energy, grasping towards living souls that pass by.

attributes.name: SendHarvestHiddenPool
attributes.description: {parameter1} Chance To Send Harvest To Hidden Pool

attributes.name: YieldBonusFromHiddenPool
attributes.description: {parameter1} Yield Bonus On Harvests From Hidden Pool

recb4m738JH0n9cua.name: Shade
recb4m738JH0n9cua.lore1: One of the most respected craftswomen in Fayhelm, Felia Zennin is peculiar woman. From claiming to have copulated with a handsome satyr to whispering to the Skytree for days on end; Felia's strange tendencies often produce good results: including fairy wings that gift the wearer with flight, and simple boots that drown out the sounds of the user's footfalls. No matter the stories (or truths) she weaves about her craftsmanship, her goods are considered among the best in Haerra.
recb4m738JH0n9cua.description: Designed by an Irondell craftswoman who claims to collaborate with fay creatures, these boots seem to naturally muffle the sound of every step.

attributes.name: HarvestCritChance
attributes.description: {parameter1} Increased Chance To Critically Harvest Yield

rec3ZIJAxTQCe3uMs.name: Folly
rec3ZIJAxTQCe3uMs.lore1: "And some might say: 'but Geshigan Meritoff III, barrels don't have lids! They have heads!' To which I respond: 'ne'er have I seen a barrel lid speak or perceive.' A barrel has as much a head as a pint of beer."
rec3ZIJAxTQCe3uMs.description: What is the state of mind that leads a person to strap a barrel's lid to their face for protection?
rec3ZIJAxTQCe3uMs.visualDescription: Intricately crafted from the finest straight-grained Ashyran oaks, steepled with perfectly anomalous swirled knots, meticulously infused with the most premier burgundy coloration on its reverse side, and expertly conjoined with the highest-quality resins and organic straw.

recFoODZHS0dXf5AY.name: Thunderchild
recFoODZHS0dXf5AY.lore1: Originally taken from a fallen giant, this greathammer was too heavy for any normal humanoid to lift. Sold as a showpiece for generations, an Archon paladin of great renown eventually purchased it and meticulously inscribed it with astra runes. Once enchanted, it was easily lifted and swung; and it crackled with the thundering rage of the alorium Borial.
recFoODZHS0dXf5AY.description: Runic inscriptions have transformed this stone hammer into a brutal conduit of Eledon's divine will.
recFoODZHS0dXf5AY.visualDescription: Crudely crafted from a stone known for its indestructibility, Thunderchild thrums with the tune of a distant storm. Inscribed with numerous runes, this hammer is dedicated to Borial, Eledon's Divine Tempest. On impact, the hammer emits a thunderclap that deafens nearby enemies.

attributes.name: RandomRuneBonus
attributes.description: {parameter1} Bonus Yield Given as a Random Rune

rec499Xs0vIuMV7jk.name: Hellreaver
rec499Xs0vIuMV7jk.lore1: One of the most prized relics of the Icefall Behemoths, Hellreaver holds a preeminent place among their ranks. Soaked with the blood of thousands of enemies and meticulously inscribed with its ever-evolving history, this mighty axe is entrusted to only the greatest among the Icefall Behemoths.
rec499Xs0vIuMV7jk.description: Passed down for generations among the barbaric Icefall Behemoths, Hellreaver embodies their vicious fighting style and terrifying war cry.
rec499Xs0vIuMV7jk.visualDescription: Runic symbols etched across the blade describe its long, bloody history. Despite its extensive use, the metal gleams as if anxious to open the next violent chapter.

recudSq7SWwNEIbKW.name: Phoenix
recudSq7SWwNEIbKW.lore1: This staff was originally created for Queen Esharit of the League of Sol. Alongside Ignition and Corona, these ancient artifacts embodied the essence of Relia, and signified a divine right to rule over the League of Sol. These raiments have since been passed down through the leadership of the League of Sol, instilling them with the power of a phoenix.
recudSq7SWwNEIbKW.description: A symbol of Relia favored by the League of Sol sits atop this staff, a brilliant representation of the kona energy infused within it.
recudSq7SWwNEIbKW.visualDescription: At the head of this tall staff perches the golden likeness of a phoenix: holy symbol of the League of Sol. The shaft is masterfully carved from a singular, long bough of rustwood. The staff is always warm to the touch, and occasionally emits showers of red-gold sparks.

attributes.name: LeaderDeathPenaltyIncrease
attributes.description: {parameter1} increase to points lost on death when leading

rec5px83gLg2FYKP6.name: Ignition
rec5px83gLg2FYKP6.lore1: These footwraps were originally created for Queen Esharit of the League of Sol. Alongside Phoenix and Corona, these ancient artifacts embodied the essence of Relia, and signified a divine right to rule over the League of Sol. These raiments have since been passed down through the leadership of the League of Sol, instilling them with the power of a phoenix.
rec5px83gLg2FYKP6.description: Silken footwraps of deep crimson, this footwear allows its bearer to streak across the battlefield like a blazing firebolt.
rec5px83gLg2FYKP6.visualDescription: These silken footwraps are favored by the League of Sol, as they are well-suited to a desert environment. Saturated red dye and an infusion of kona mark these as belonging to a disciple of Relia.

recjVVPXl5FFRKvaC.name: Corona
recjVVPXl5FFRKvaC.lore1: These robes were originally created for Queen Esharit of the League of Sol. Alongside Phoenix and Ignition, these ancient artifacts embodied the essence of Relia, and signified a divine right to rule over the League of Sol. These raiments have since been passed down through the leadership of the League of Sol, instilling them with the power of a phoenix.
recjVVPXl5FFRKvaC.description: Worn by advanced mages in the League of Sol, these bright red silken robes exude Kona energy like brilliant sunbursts, and greatly increase the wearer's ability to manipulate fire. When worn above
recjVVPXl5FFRKvaC.visualDescription: Masterfully weaved from threads of crimson and gold, these robes are truly befitting of royalty. The envy of all disciples of kona, this garb is emblazoned with brilliant markings of a long-forgotten language and subjected to the breath of a phoenix.

recWSJRSyxdhAHGqb.name: Purity
recWSJRSyxdhAHGqb.lore1: Compared to most Archon artifacts, this lightlance was constructed late in their history. Only about a century old, it was designed to be used from the back of the Archon's formidable mounts: the stormwhales of Myst Reef.
recWSJRSyxdhAHGqb.description: An advanced Archon weapon whose pointed tip crackles with divine Astra energy. Lightlances were given to only the most martially capable of Archons, making them both a signifier of prowess, and a salient threat to the chaospawn dregs.
recWSJRSyxdhAHGqb.visualDescription: Of platinum gilding and silver make, this halberd is both awe-inspiring and terrifying. Wreathed in blinding astra energy, its multiple razor-edged blades are designed to purify through annihilation.

recH4aB3vswG1MZAh.name: Fortitude
recH4aB3vswG1MZAh.visualDescription: Despite clear wear and tear, this layered body armor offers reliable protection.

recVBIZjitL1HOsBE.name: Presence
recVBIZjitL1HOsBE.visualDescription: This platinum circlet seems to bestow upon its wearer an aura of unresistable charisma and authority.

attributes.name: GuildTreasuryYieldBonus
attributes.description: {parameter1} Yield Bonus, Sent To Guild Treasury

recImfd6IOmg0cmos.name: Reave
recImfd6IOmg0cmos.description: Shaped by the hands of a revered Barbarian artisan, these boots were designed to support a life of constant combat.

attributes.name: HarvestOverTime

recN3129irT0TPwAA.name: Flare
recN3129irT0TPwAA.description: A vibrant red skirt and leggings worn by advanced wielders of Kona in the league of Sol, matching their religious depictions of Relia and her closest followers. Compliments the use of fire-based magics.

attributes.name: HarvestOverTime

recxrDnpITv6mOEac.name: Voidmaw
recxrDnpITv6mOEac.description: As though a piece of the abyss was seized and chained in physical form, this amulet consumes all light that falls upon it.

recmIVdbpq6gjeHrW.name: Exile
recmIVdbpq6gjeHrW.description: This chaos-imbued blade thirsts for life to such an extent that even the wielder's is consumed once it is drawn.

rec1RGZKNc18a82ZQ.name: Icebrand
rec1RGZKNc18a82ZQ.description: The translucent material that comprises this blade shimmers like ice when exposed to the light. When drawn, the blade seems to scour the heat out of the surrounding air.

attributes.name: SendHarvestHiddenPool

recNvckjZsKRxPtou.name: Capacity
recNvckjZsKRxPtou.description: A colorful homage to the goddess of Mana. These robes improve the wearer's ability to hold and channel energy, but provide little direct protection.
recNvckjZsKRxPtou.visualDescription: A colorful homage to the goddess of Mana. These robes improve the wearer's ability to hold and channel energy, but provide little direct protection.

recJfpKI4qjS63uiR.name: Ecliptic
recJfpKI4qjS63uiR.description: Thrumming with an unearthly cadence, these gloves gift the wearer with the unerring accuracy of an astralyte archer.

recORjq3pYfSVP1Cq.name: Pulsar
recORjq3pYfSVP1Cq.description: This otherworldly weapon hums with imbued Astra energy, seemingly ready to release a cascade of holy fire upon slightest provocation.

reciLG2pe9YPc2Eq4.name: Torrent
reciLG2pe9YPc2Eq4.description: The inscribed bands of an Archon, used to transform the energies of the wielder into a certain form. These bands bear runic symbols resembling ocean waves.

recslIYdXFNAnnMtj.name: Diligence
recslIYdXFNAnnMtj.description: A Witchhunter's religious zeal is only matched by their fervor for the erasure of chaospawn.
recslIYdXFNAnnMtj.visualDescription: A Witchhunter's religious zeal is only matched by their fervor for the erasure of chaospawn.

recPx6HwR3uHOHzCe.name: Miasma
recPx6HwR3uHOHzCe.description: A foreboding, noxious aura emanates from the top of this staff, fashioned of a branch harvested from the Hexgard druids' toxic groves.

attributes.name: HarvestOverTime
attributes.description: Add {parameter1} To Harvest, Vested Over Time

reciOkiwLiszx3iA6.name: Horizon
reciOkiwLiszx3iA6.description: Perfect for soaring the ethereal skies, these boots enable the wearer to travel a mile in a moment, ensuring destruction in their wake.

recS2lzJMmBnYaFzA.name: Star
recS2lzJMmBnYaFzA.description: Like the light from a star, Korryn's vision is boundless, ensuring no minions of chaos can escape his judgment.

recUqFk9R83w7mDWK.name: Legacy
recUqFk9R83w7mDWK.description: Former head of the Great Bear Sokhe, this ancestral mark of leadership imbues the wearer with the combined ferocity of Legacy's past owners.
recUqFk9R83w7mDWK.visualDescription: Despite witnessing much blood and toil, this weathered and oily bear pelt embodies a brutal regality, fitting of only the fiercest and wisest barbarian chiefs.

attributes.name: RandomRuneExchangeSpecific
attributes.description: {parameter1} Chance That Random Rune Exchange Gives A Specific Rune

recENYs1KS0nepuOp.name: Pillage
recENYs1KS0nepuOp.description: One of the most brutal barbarian tools, this teeth studded, disembodied claw was devised to lock down even the slipperiest of opponents.
recENYs1KS0nepuOp.visualDescription: Numerous razor-sharp teeth are embedded into a bloodied claw of unknown origin, affixed to a long, wrought iron chain. The savage appearance of this grappling weapon is only surpassed by the cruel fate that awaits those caught in Pillage's grasp.

recS5rJYE28Ldq6hc.name: Bloodline
recS5rJYE28Ldq6hc.description: Used to both intimidate enemies and signify allegiance, elder barbarians use these energy-infused warpaints to spark a trance-like rage.
recS5rJYE28Ldq6hc.visualDescription: Though pigments of all types are used in this sacred pre-battle tradition, the most common warpaint among the Tribe of Carnage is fashioned with the blood of fallen enemies.

attributes.name: RandomRuneExchangeSpecific
attributes.description: {parameter1} Chance That Random Rune Exchange Gives A Specific Rune

recVxp7vKQybPFyBn.name: Frenzy
recVxp7vKQybPFyBn.description: Crafted from tanned behemoth hide and enchanted with ancient primal magic, these hide leggings allow the wearer's footfalls to shake the earth like a mighty behemoth.
recVxp7vKQybPFyBn.visualDescription: Composed of various tanned leathers and resilient cloths, these behemoth hide trousers show the evident wear and tear of many mighty generations.

recgw1Z0RKjXnoOt8.name: Shroud
recgw1Z0RKjXnoOt8.description: This leaf-adorned cloak is both stunning to behold and practical for making oneself invisible in the dense forests of Fayhelm.
recgw1Z0RKjXnoOt8.visualDescription: Made by esteemed elven weavers, the soft fabric of this cloak is interwoven with magically-preserved leaves. As the seasons change, so too do the color of the leaves: from deep emerald in the summer to gold and red in the autumn. While beautiful, it also remains purely practical; allowing elven hunters to conceal themselves year-round in the ever-changing woodland.

recys5XxAGe3R3oR5.name: Conclave
recys5XxAGe3R3oR5.description: Adorned with the sigil of a Warden commander, this prestigious ranger garb gifts its wearer the dexterity of a galewind.
recys5XxAGe3R3oR5.visualDescription: Created by the finest smiths and tailors in Irondell, this light and tactile armor bears the high-quality elements of both human and elven craftsmanship. Imbued with dyes found in Fayhelm and embellished with the Warden's silvery symbol, this garb was finally enchanted with druidic wind magic.

attributes.description: {parameter1} Yield Bonus On Harvests From Hidden Pool

recLZYTaWltOpyV87.name: Celerity
recLZYTaWltOpyV87.description: Forged from the scales of a fallen basilisk, these gauntlets allow the wearer to strike with the petrifying venom of the legendary reptile.
recLZYTaWltOpyV87.visualDescription: Though these basilisk scale gauntlets glitter a brilliant emerald green in direct sunlight, they are virtually invisible in the shade of the Fayhelm forests. Expertly replated as ranger gloves, these gauntlets provide both excellent offensive and defensive capabilities.

attributes.name: SendHarvestHiddenPool
attributes.description: {parameter1} Chance To Send Harvest To Hidden Pool

attributes.name: YieldBonusToHiddenPool
attributes.description: {parameter1} yield bonus on harvests to hidden pool

recZqR8fXUhHVEVRK.name: Slipstream
recZqR8fXUhHVEVRK.description: Arrows shot from this elegant dryad bow are said to visibly cut the air as they fly, creating rippling airwaves in their wake.
recZqR8fXUhHVEVRK.visualDescription: Gifted to the Wardens of Irondell by a dryad ally, this elegant wooden bow is one of the finest crafted in Haerra. Blessed with ancient fey magic lost to humanoids, Slipstream is virtually weightless and only requires the faintest effort to draw.

attributes.name: SendHarvestHiddenPool
attributes.description: {parameter1} Chance To Send Harvest To Hidden Pool

attributes.name: YieldBonusFromHiddenPool
attributes.description: {parameter1} Yield Bonus On Harvests From Hidden Pool

recz3b3kk8fAJpWDe.name: Myriad
recz3b3kk8fAJpWDe.description: Sister to the legendary bow Slipstream, this elegant wooden quiver enchants the arrows stored within: providing both true striking and incineration capabilities.
recz3b3kk8fAJpWDe.visualDescription: Sharing both wood-carved sophistication and magical weightlessness with her sister bow Slipstream, Myriad is the envy of all archers. In addition to enchanting stored arrows, this quiver also prevents arrows from falling out during the wearer's acrobatic feats; only releasing if the owner draws from quiver directly.

recXnpKckgzRwp1sn.name: Void
recXnpKckgzRwp1sn.description: "Tell me: when you gaze into the empty eyes of a Craven, can you be certain it's a _thing _that gazes back?"
recXnpKckgzRwp1sn.visualDescription: Brutally forged from hallowed brass, the Void mask embodies the depravity of the Cravens. When adorned alongside the energy-nullifying hat, this headgear serves as a sinister omen to passersby.

recrjZlxF2JrxlCjA.name: Lawmaker
recrjZlxF2JrxlCjA.description: Proudly displaying the tickets of victorious Craven hunts, this Craven coat is a symbol of order in the lawless lands of Woto Shonok.
recrjZlxF2JrxlCjA.visualDescription: Crammed with all manner of tinctures, scrolls, weapons, poisons, staves, nomicons, and many other hidden tools; Lawmaker exudes the preparedness and competence of a Craven hunter.

reclfCVq3nQNxvN5b.name: Flay
reclfCVq3nQNxvN5b.description: The Craven's precision-weapon of choice, this legendary crossbow has witnessed the death and suffering of both men and monsters.
reclfCVq3nQNxvN5b.visualDescription: Fashioned from rusted metal and polished silver, Flay marries the harsh ruggedness of a Craven with the precision of their craft. The crow-feathered bolts shot from this crossbow are fitted with all types of heads: from razor-sharp splitting heads to viciously-serrated shredding heads.

recZrjCXwSpWHTTa9.name: Lawbreaker
recZrjCXwSpWHTTa9.description: Used in close-quarters combat, the metallic spikes fitted to Lawbreaker's boot-ends are great for splitting kneecaps in a pinch.
recZrjCXwSpWHTTa9.visualDescription: Crudely beautiful and viciously practical, the tips of these intimidating boots are fitted with silver staves. Made from sturdy hide and equipped with multi-purpose straps and pouches, these Craven boots often contain several knives hidden from view.

rechKBlMBP4hJwdyT.name: Scholar's Codex
rechKBlMBP4hJwdyT.description: Rewarded to Arken Scholars for their noble service.

recKnkD34CQ8JGm8i.name: General's Medallion
recKnkD34CQ8JGm8i.description: Rewarded to Rune Generals for their valiant service.

recii97QZknkJO97a.name: Crafting Competition Certificate
recii97QZknkJO97a.description: Given as a token of excellence in crafting.

rec6tc35ugUcqZ2eo.name: Founder's Cube
rec6tc35ugUcqZ2eo.description: Founder's Cube will be redeemable for multiple benefits within Rune's ecosystem.

recQ5WxKPYaT7hAP8.name: Black Drake Scale
recQ5WxKPYaT7hAP8.description: A rigid, fire resistant plate that once protected the body of a mature black drake. The circumstances of the drake's death have left this scale and its defensive properties well preserved- an uncommon occurrence.

recDr0oDpgJsj8PVd.name: Black Drake Talon
recDr0oDpgJsj8PVd.description: Razor sharp and menacing, these talons can rarely be found scattered across the Mage Isles, acting as an enduring and grim reminder of the brutal violence that once filled the skies around them.

recDqK4dCS3DbuVmW.name: Glowfly Powder
recDqK4dCS3DbuVmW.description: Once fully suffused with arcane energy, the glowflies that fill the skies of the Mage Isles begin to produce this powder. It has become a popular tool among magic users seeking to quickly restore their stores of mana.

reck2ucSMBiV8OZbm.name: Fairy Drake

rec35ahp6w9OMQy7o.name: Hippogryph
rec35ahp6w9OMQy7o.description: The esteemed mount of kings and emperors, a hippogryph strikes like lightning from above, outpacing even dragons with its speed and agility.

recshxIIbcq6bpRXp.name: Wyvern
recshxIIbcq6bpRXp.description: Though often considered second to dragons, such considerations fail to account for the wyvern's vicious brutality. A dragon kills for food; a wyvern kills for entertainment.

reczwZfc1Km7qv0ze.name: Mataro Gold
reczwZfc1Km7qv0ze.description: Harder than steel, Mataro Gold is a special type of ice that only melts under extreme cold, and thus can only be forged under the breath weapon of an ice dragon.

recUYPfnA1u8UscHT.name: Rustwood
recUYPfnA1u8UscHT.description: Unique to the Copper Desert, the aptly-named Rustwood Tree has a red-brown coloration. These trees are resistant to heat and require very little water survive. In the hot season, Rustwood Trees blossom with rich barhi dates. Rustwood is prized for its sturdiness, beautiful red coloration, and heat-conductive properties.

recxgFMdpXK7hW7Lr.name: Ebik Steel
recxgFMdpXK7hW7Lr.description: Ebik Steel is the only material known to suppress energy. Once refined, this dull, rusty metal scintillates with a brilliant red color, and is used to forge anti-energy weapons, shackles, and cages. Only one Ebik Steel mine exists on Haerra, isolated in the mountains east of Westmarsh. The mine is incredibly treacherous: the rock here is weak and ripe for collapse, and noxious gas from sulphur dioxide and hydrogen sulphide silently kills dozens of miners daily. Adding to the danger, monsters frequently occupy these winding tunnel shafts, striking unsuspecting minters from the darkness.

recX4G8blErFtuUl9.name: Glowfly Powder
recX4G8blErFtuUl9.description: Once fully suffused with arcane energy, the glowflies that fill the skies of the Mage Isles begin to produce this powder. It has become a popular tool among magic users seeking to quickly restore their stores of mana.

reciaMBLiPDkNGfp9.name: Hexgard Spores
reciaMBLiPDkNGfp9.description: Poisonous spores harvested from certain flora in Mycelia.

recxD6VfhYW3wy23u.name: Mystweaver Coral
recxD6VfhYW3wy23u.description: This porous coral comes in many colors: from red to teal to yellow. When treated and forged like metal, however, this coral strengthens to an incredible degree. Used as a very lightweight alternative to steel, this coveted material can be forged into featherweight armor and sturdy, razor-sharp weapons.

recllqD8DzQC5GKi0.name: Wyrm Teeth
recllqD8DzQC5GKi0.description: Potent when enchanted with temporal energy, and best used with time- or speed-altering items.

recR2v5fsTv9GzK3h.name: StepsTaken
recR2v5fsTv9GzK3h.example: The player must have moved 25 in-game units since the last execution.

rec21aTip6dtXAcu7.name: UniqueEnemiesKilled
rec21aTip6dtXAcu7.example: The player must have killed 3 unique enemies during the match.

recCMb8IIXuZsfnwT.name: WinStreak
recCMb8IIXuZsfnwT.example: The player must be on a winning streak of 3 matches or more.

rec94La6kiwbf80Fc.name: KillStreak
rec94La6kiwbf80Fc.explanation: if no optional args, triggers with every kill
rec94La6kiwbf80Fc.example: The player must have an ongoing killstreak of 5 or more.

recA9AsJReI4eNyxF.name: StatCriterion
recA9AsJReI4eNyxF.example: Player must be at perfect health.

reclQewDALQGspvL1.name: UsedNearby
reclQewDALQGspvL1.description: when {p1} is used nearby [{p2} times within {p3} seconds.
reclQewDALQGspvL1.example: An enemy must have used a movement skill nearby.

recslJmO2zCqEK7sV.name: CriticalHits
recslJmO2zCqEK7sV.description: when landing [{p2}] critical hit[s in {p3} seconds].

rechsjYgPGQgDdfLT.name: DoTNearby
rechsjYgPGQgDdfLT.description: when a nearby {p1} is taking [{p2}] damage over time.
rechsjYgPGQgDdfLT.explanation: Enemy within set distance has DoT effects of a given type underway

recOvK8AoUvhw6IUv.name: PerfectDodge
recOvK8AoUvhw6IUv.description: after perfectly dodging attacks {p1} time(s) [in {p2} seconds].

recDFqz88H94fX0yR.name: TimeWithoutHits
recDFqz88H94fX0yR.explanation: Player has not hit an enemy in over 5s

recvRG0UOvXz8qF8o.name: SkillTypeHits
recvRG0UOvXz8qF8o.example: Player hits an enemy with a skill classified as "Melee"

reckqM7vrUBNO1lyJ.name: TimeWithoutSkillTypeHits
reckqM7vrUBNO1lyJ.explanation: A more specific version of "TimeWithoutHits" that requires a specific type of skill to land the hit

rec6zL14q0RJ4sj3L.name: Wins
rec6zL14q0RJ4sj3L.explanation: Amount of career wins, optionally constricted to the last {time?}.

recim0PHXl9WyFdx6.name: CurrentStatOffset
recim0PHXl9WyFdx6.explanation: The deviation of {stat} from its base value due to stat mods

recTSDtNx7upSI5xx.name: EnemyOfType
recTSDtNx7upSI5xx.example: Player hits a foe tagged as "summon"

reci5WXEJLQ78cskw.name: Poison
reci5WXEJLQ78cskw.explanation: When poisoned, a player's avatar begins following the mouse as if it were rotated from center a certain number of degrees (rolled randomly once poison is applied).
reci5WXEJLQ78cskw.description: A powerful poison has overcome you, altering your perception of the world.

recW6uVLLCm3wdyO7.name: Bleed
recW6uVLLCm3wdyO7.explanation: When bleeding, a player takes more damage, and is more likely to receive critical hits and other ailments.
recW6uVLLCm3wdyO7.description: Deep, rending wounds have left you vulnerable to further damage.

recbFYFXWn54Aqsy2.name: Freeze
recbFYFXWn54Aqsy2.explanation: When frozen, movement and attack/cast speed is reduced.
recbFYFXWn54Aqsy2.description: A bone-deep chill has racked you, making it difficult to move quickly.

recOVqLIOn26ECNeG.name: Stun
recOVqLIOn26ECNeG.explanation: When stunned, the player's avatar slows to a stop (like a bird that has stopped flapping its wings).
recOVqLIOn26ECNeG.description: Your perception is overwhelmed, leaving you immobile.

rec3SZ0IGWvEIl6eD.name: Burn
rec3SZ0IGWvEIl6eD.explanation: When burned, the player takes damage when receiving movement speed increases and turning, with the damage increasing for sharp turns.
rec3SZ0IGWvEIl6eD.description: Flames have scoured you, leaving their mark as a lingering pain that intensifies when you exert yourself.

recNgHGTFb17YMxqJ.name: BloodDrunk
recNgHGTFb17YMxqJ.explanation: When blooddrunk, a player's avatar no longer follows the mouse with a straight vector. Its path begins resembling a sine wave, with the amplitude increasing with every kill.
recNgHGTFb17YMxqJ.description: You find it harder to control yourself the more you feast upon your victims.

recxyBzLzU8Ad15iI.name: Sacrifice
recxyBzLzU8Ad15iI.explanation:
Player has a chance of receiving this debuff upon taking the lead/winning a match.  

Evo: Not only do they glow as normal , every player is always notified of their position. If the player wins with this debuff having been applied for at least two minutes, they receive a 20% win bonus and carry Sacrifice into the next round.

Infinite: They are assailed by demon NPCs during the match.
recxyBzLzU8Ad15iI.description: You are branded a sacrifice. Those who defeat you will be rewarded.

recak4xce4ErqjJCi.name: Silence
recak4xce4ErqjJCi.description: You are unable to use spell skills.

rec9kLXBgRKmdclRs.name: Blind
rec9kLXBgRKmdclRs.description: Your vision has gone dark, leaving you unable to see more than a few feet in front of you.

recU9U7fO3WfmnFKy.name: Sick
recU9U7fO3WfmnFKy.description: Your body is racked with illness, and eating seems to make it worse.

recvLb34jBIkREpSk.name: Slow
recvLb34jBIkREpSk.explanation: When slowed, movement and attack speed is reduced to a lesser extent than freezing, but projectiles and skill cooldowns are also affected.
recvLb34jBIkREpSk.description: The world around you seems to be moving much faster. Or are you moving slower?

recN6TG6Hdf40Kxh9.name: EvolveLock
recN6TG6Hdf40Kxh9.explanation: If the player is a dragonling or whelp, they will not evolve even if their bar is filled.
recN6TG6Hdf40Kxh9.description: No matter how much you consume, you can't seem to evolve past your current state.

recTNEVACVqOHkTCF.name: Complacent
recTNEVACVqOHkTCF.explanation: Jester's folly aura. Reduces damage, damage resistance.
recTNEVACVqOHkTCF.description: Is this person serious? That's literally a flat piece of wood...

recaWBJvtiZhw2L7t.name: Rooted
recaWBJvtiZhw2L7t.description: You are unable to use your movement skills.

rec8SZI6INWl7ZxiM.name: Airborne
rec8SZI6INWl7ZxiM.description: An attack has caused you to lose your footing.

recLws53TzKbFFhcz.name: Sleep
recLws53TzKbFFhcz.explanation: The character fells on a slumber, vision darkens, disables movement.  Sleeping units are awakened upon taking damage.
recLws53TzKbFFhcz.description: You fell into a deep slumber

rec5vFTQRhsHNhOFX.name: Shatter
rec5vFTQRhsHNhOFX.explanation: Receives increased damage after petrification/freeze/block is broken
rec5vFTQRhsHNhOFX.description: You take increased damage from all damage types

recY7Mjbz0bTg69fS.name: Polymorph
recY7Mjbz0bTg69fS.explanation: Units under polymorph are transformed into a critter (frog,fish,insect etc) movement is slowed  to 10% of base. Unable to cast spells use items etc.
recY7Mjbz0bTg69fS.description: You are transformed into a critter.

recPMQrhv13G2OpMG.name: Healing Prevention
recPMQrhv13G2OpMG.description: Player can not use healing and receives no benefit from regenerative effects.

recLAxh9M7riennR5.name: Ethereal
recLAxh9M7riennR5.explanation: Ethereal units are disarmed, takes additional magical damage.
recLAxh9M7riennR5.description: Unit is transferred to another plain, leaving their spirit remnant.

recLRmB7C7A8E4ROg.name: Haste
recLRmB7C7A8E4ROg.explanation: When hasted, the speed of actions increases and spell cooldowns are reduced.
recLRmB7C7A8E4ROg.description: The world around you seems to be moving much more slowly. Or are you moving faster?

recqwKaBFy415FcNo.name: GuildLeadership
recqwKaBFy415FcNo.explanation: Small buffs to movement, attack, and defense.
recqwKaBFy415FcNo.description: A high-ranking member of your guild is nearby, and you are motivated to impress.

recEuPt4k5nX0kPI0.name: BurstOfSpeed
recEuPt4k5nX0kPI0.description: A short-lived burst of movement speed.

recGMGCV0qeg1Od0A.name: Disarm
recGMGCV0qeg1Od0A.explanation: unable to attack using physical attacks / causes the character to attack using their own fist = little to damage

recORzQ3RVtWfdQeN.name: Petrify
recORzQ3RVtWfdQeN.explanation: Renders the character immobile, unable to use spells or attack and is vulnerable to physical attacks
recORzQ3RVtWfdQeN.description: Turns the character into stone. Can be shattered for increase damaged

recCaI3bTEiduf3yG.name: Fear
recCaI3bTEiduf3yG.explanation: forced movement away from the caster. Unable to attack or cast spells
recCaI3bTEiduf3yG.description: Causes you to run away due to terror

recllPiyRao5mXPDo.name: Confuse
recllPiyRao5mXPDo.explanation: Inverted controls. moving up makes your character move down. turning left will make your character turn right
recllPiyRao5mXPDo.description: Disrupts the ability of the player to control their unit

recFuseBKLMBzETGl.name: Parry
recFuseBKLMBzETGl.explanation:
Players should be able to strike down incoming projectiles with Physical attack if timed correctly. 

ex: fireballs, arrows, bolts etc. 
doesnt affect beam type or aoe effect spells
recFuseBKLMBzETGl.description: When timed right, allows the character to strike incoming projectiles destroying it in the process

reca8v1egDF6PpG8T.name: Block
reca8v1egDF6PpG8T.explanation: Player takes reduce damage from incoming attacks. Block is broken when a certain damage point is reached which then results to vulnerable/ shatter state.
reca8v1egDF6PpG8T.description: blocks incoming spells/ projectiles and physical attacks.  Takes reduce damage until block threshold is broken

recCvUYfIjIz4iMxM.name: Reflect
recCvUYfIjIz4iMxM.explanation: reflects projectiles back to the caster.

recLV4uPGLstLKoeA.name: Oil
recLV4uPGLstLKoeA.description: Unit receives amplified damage from fire based spells and increases slow of ice based spells

recOIgetlJpM9xgGH.name: Wet
recOIgetlJpM9xgGH.description:
Unit receives amplified damage from lightning spells and is render vulnerable to freeze 
reduced damaged from fire based spells

recRXAKt2VWkI3aNo.name: HP Critical
recRXAKt2VWkI3aNo.description: Activates when a unit reached a certain percent of their HP. Can induce positive /negative buffs

recVnB7vciWdtNAYf.name: Magnetism
recVnB7vciWdtNAYf.explanation: Draws enemies in to the source

recm4G2sBtOqgKCgb.name: MovementDamage
recm4G2sBtOqgKCgb.explanation: Damages enemies that move across the affected area

recwbhFfqumf1bDUc.name: The First Order
recwbhFfqumf1bDUc.shortDescription: Scholars and time mages brought together by Bin Zy in the service of Zeno.
recwbhFfqumf1bDUc.description: A secretive group of scholars and time mages, brought together by Bin Zy in the service of Zeno. Though their exact tenants remain unknown, they are dedicated to the mastery of time and the protection of Haerra from those who would seek its undoing.
recwbhFfqumf1bDUc.lore2: The First Order are a group of scholars which formed many years ago, brought together by a figure named Bin Zy. Its purpose was to study and learn from a cache of secret texts and documents hidden away in the abandoned remains of an ancient temple. It is not known what religion or Gods were worshiped there, which is the reason for the formation of The First Order. Their discoveries of the texts are kept as a great secret and noted in a giant book known as the Book of Secrets.
recwbhFfqumf1bDUc.lore3:
MEMBERSHIP

Peoples of all backgrounds are welcomed into the First Order of Zeno. Rangers are needed to hunt and scout for important peoples and resources, while arcane practitioners can gear their talents towards mastering temporal energy. Barbarians are valued as zealous defenders and necromancers for their understanding of the cycle of life and death. As long as you can find them, becoming a member of the First Order is a straightforward task. In order to join the ranks of these time wielders, you must simply disclose your intentions to the Archdeacon. If the Archdeacon finds these intentions to be pure, then you are welcomed with open arms. If not, you will be turned away with no explanation or appeal.

recVeskvT3kVHSft9.name: Archivists
recVeskvT3kVHSft9.shortDescription: Keepers of lore and the guardians of Haerra's history.
recVeskvT3kVHSft9.description: These brave souls revere Zeno, the God of Time, and wade into battle wielding parchment, tome, and quill. They are renowned keepers of lore, guardians of knowledge, and protectors of Haerra's long-forgotten secrets.
recVeskvT3kVHSft9.lore2: The Archivists are a quasi-religious order based in Westmarsh who serve and revere Zeno, the God of Time. These brave souls wade into battle wielding parchments, tomes and quills, armoured not in ensorcelled plate or links of chain, but with the knowledge of generations past. In their case the pen really is mightier than the sword. The Archivists hold many secrets and forgotten knowledge and fight not only for the future of humanity, but also to save mankind's past and heritage. The members of their honored fraternity are many, and their numbers grow every day.
recVeskvT3kVHSft9.lore3:
MEMBERSHIP

A valued distinction among scholars and a prestigious title across Haerra, becoming an Archivist is not an easy task. Archivists are expected to be able to wade into the depths of a battle and the frigid icecaps of the Frostlands to carry out their duties. Furthermore, only a handful of new Archivists are selected each year, among the hundreds that apply. To be considered for the position, you must both be educated in a scholarly discipline and have received some military or arcane training. You must present your qualifications to a member of the order and, if selected, take a rigorous test meant to assess not only your scholarly abilities, but also your mental and physical fortitude. Only after you pass this test will you be considered for admittance.

reczLxiGi4NVpHLSO.name: Knights of Westmarsh
reczLxiGi4NVpHLSO.shortDescription: Knights of purity and enforcers of justice.
reczLxiGi4NVpHLSO.description: Armed with gleaming plate and blade, the Knights of Westmarsh are an order of fighters sworn to protect the defenseless against the evils of Haerra. Every knight has renounced the ways of the flesh, forging their minds and bodies anew in service of a greater good.
reczLxiGi4NVpHLSO.lore2: The Knights of Westmarsh are an order of knights sworn to protect the defenseless against the evils of Haerra. They refuse alcohol and the ways of the flesh, remaining celibate throughout their ordination and service. Although during the Darkening of Victram the Knights closely followed the teachings of the Azaran, in recent years they have turned to secularity, focused more on defending Westmarsh from physical harm than defending its spirituality.
reczLxiGi4NVpHLSO.lore3:
MEMBERSHIP

Becoming a Knight of Westmarsh is a simple process, as almost all who request entrance are admitted. The only barrier to entry is the sworn oath: to defend Haerra against evil and to relinquish earthly ties–including alcohol and sex. Though joining the Knights is an easy task, maintaining your position will be the true challenge. Their orders are stringent and their standards high–even so far as having a branch of their order dedicated to rooting out corruption and ensuring oaths are kept. If you are found to be in contempt of your oath at any point during your service, you are immediately relieved of your position.

rec76DhpXPfUjKjJo.name: Vira
rec76DhpXPfUjKjJo.shortDescription: An innovative people who are small in stature but well-adapted to their harsh desert homes.
rec76DhpXPfUjKjJo.description: The vira are small people with a chip on their shoulder concerning their size. They appear like slender, hairless dwarves with more pointed ears and longer, more flexible hands and fingers. As a race they are excitable, shouty and argumentative. However, their saving grace is the fact that they are exceptionally brilliant engineers and handymen and women. Not only can they create mechanisms driven by clockwork and create complex structures like dams and towers, but they can also mend just about anything that has been broken (with the exception of hearts). They roam the different countries in small pony driven carts packed full of tools and useful items. They charge a fair price for their work but one should never attempt to take advantage of them as they are ferocious little fighters with daggers and short swords.
rec76DhpXPfUjKjJo.lore1:
**FLAVOR TEXT (EXAMPLE):**

**"**Skinny and flaxen-haired, his skin walnut brown and his eyes a startling turquoise, Burgell stood half as tall as Aeron and had to climb up on a stool to look out the peephole. Like most habitations in Oeble, that particular tenement had been built for humans, and smaller residents coped with the resulting awkwardness as best they could.
But at least the relative largeness of the apartment gave Burgell room to pack in all his gnome-sized gear. The front room was his workshop, and it contained a bewildering miscellany of tools: hammers, chisels, saws, lockpicks, tinted lenses, jeweler’s loupes, and jars of powdered and shredded ingredients for casting spells. A fat gray cat, the mage’s familiar, lay curled atop a grimoire. It opened its eyes, gave Aeron a disdainful yellow stare, then appeared to go back to sleep."
rec76DhpXPfUjKjJo.lore2:
**VIRA GUILDS AND CRAFTSMANSHIP**

While the Vira’s Desert Kilran cousins focus their creativity on chaotic mechanical contraptions and alchemical reactions, the Vira prefer to channel their energy into more refined forms of crafting. Any such crafting heavily involves the Guilds. Much of Vira society is ordered around the Guilds, which are regarded with near-religious reverence by many Vira. Guild membership is determined by birth, and many families have remained in the same discipline for centuries. Certain guilds, such as the Architects Guild, are renowned above others; creating a quasi-caste system that changes depending on which guilds are high in demand.
rec76DhpXPfUjKjJo.lore3:
**KILRAN INNOVATION AND ARTIFICE**

Just like their Vira cousins, the Kilrans pride themselves on curiosity and ingenuity. While the Vira are a shade more reserved in their creation, the Kilrans pursue progress unbridled by restraint. Explosions frequently rock their towns and cities, constructs come to life and wreak havoc, and rarely-tested airships lose control and crash into towers that are resurrected two to three times a year. But with such risk comes great reward, and the Kilrans exemplify this above all others: embracing the chaos to generate incredible innovations.

recA1FISeoYRLo8yW.name: Dwarf
recA1FISeoYRLo8yW.geography: Western Ashyrah Spine (Dwarven Mountains) and central Haerra
recA1FISeoYRLo8yW.shortDescription: These short and stocky humanoids pride themselves on their fine smithing abilities and rugged mining lifestyle.
recA1FISeoYRLo8yW.description: Similarly to the small and slim vira, most adult dwarves stand around four feet tall. Most dwarves share similarly rugged characteristics, boasting a stout and sturdy build, wide nose, and thick beard. It is difficult to tell male and female dwarves apart as both genders tend to grow facial hair. They live in the mountains where they create great tunnels that lead to their mines that produce a wide variety of precious metals including gold, silver, lead and copper. These metals are traded in the large dwarven marketplaces that occur in different locations at certain times of the year. Dwarves tend to specialize in tasks based on their family lines: some focus on mining while others on engineering and smithing. Given these few areas of specialization, dwarven societies tend to produce items of the highest quality: their forged weapons and armor said by many to be the best on Haerra. Dwarves are often suspicious of other humanoids and like to keep to themselves, though they won’t back down from a fight. Despite their stockiness, they are dangerous opponents: able to both hack with axe and pierce with blade.
recA1FISeoYRLo8yW.lore2:
**UNDERGROUND AND THRIVING**

Traditionally an underground people, many dwarves have adapted to their environment over millennia. From vision that sees clearly in darkness (but poorly in light) to spectacular abilities allowing them to smell even the smallest bits of rust, dwarves are the perfect miners. Their low light vision allows them to use torches sparingly, and any glittering object–gem or metal–glows like a beacon in the darkness. Meanwhile, when oxygen from their tunnels even slightly corrodes metal, dwarves are able to smell it from great distances and even through dense dirt walls. Even despite this natural affinity for mining and tunnel-dwelling, some dwarves–like those in Der’uden–have adapted to life above ground. Over long periods of exposure to fresh air and light, however, their keen senses of smell and superior dark vision begin to fade.
recA1FISeoYRLo8yW.lore3:
**GREAT DWARVEN SCHISM**

Once, dwarven civilizations used to span hills, mountains, and forests in northwestern Ashyrah. Though composed of several large fiefdoms, they were united under a common King. After their victory against the elves in the Battle of Shady Woods many centuries ago, their influence increased further. For a number of decades it looked as though the dwarves would expand their civilization to incredible heights. However, one fateful night the King at the time, King Gentir II, was assassinated by a dwarf of another faction. The dwarven fiefdoms instantly exploded into war, each blaming the other, and the casualties were innumerable. When the dust settled, only three factions remained, each significantly weakened and disheartened. These former fiefdoms then isolated themselves: one settled in the hills north of the Copper Desert, one migrated to the ice-scapes of Der’uden, and the last withdrew into the mountainous Morgraf Hold.

recnRTvNIkyd67S5L.name: Elf
recnRTvNIkyd67S5L.shortDescription: Tall and slender with pointed ears and faintly shimmering metallic skin, elves are both accomplished magic-users and skilled fighters.
recnRTvNIkyd67S5L.description: After their defeat at the hands of the dwarves at the Battle of Shady Woods, the Elves retreated deep into the Forests of Fayhelm. Here, they avoided contact with all races and peoples for centuries, save the druids. During that time, the elves split into tribes and kingdoms, developing unique cultures from each other. Some live in bowers constructed within trees, while others live in ornate cities hidden deep in the woods. Elves are slightly taller than the average human and slender in appearance, with a natural metallic sheen to their fair skin: gold tints in the north and silver to the south. They have pointed ears and slender hands with long fingers and are expert spellcasters and fighters–especially with the bow. They live longer than humans, however as many of their kind were killed in battle, they are considerably fewer in number. As time progresses, certain groups of elves have begun to reintegrate with society, while others remain isolated and distrusting of outsiders.
recnRTvNIkyd67S5L.lore2:
**A PEOPLE OF EONS**

To many elves, the passing of other humanoid eras seems a mere moment. Though not immortal, the average elf lives to well over five hundred years. This incredible lifespan shapes elven society in ways unique to other Haerran peoples. Elves rarely have more than one or two children, resulting in a very small population. But that small population grows to be very powerful: with five human lifetimes for spellcasters to master the arcane and archers to perfect their aim. With such long lives, however, many elves become jaded and stuck in their ways, able to clearly recall past slights and insults that other races would lose to history. As such, elven societies progress slowly with time–if at all–and change is often discouraged. Every once in a while, elves like the esteemed Etarian Yra surface with radical ideas and the charisma to pursue them–though these instances are few and far between.
recnRTvNIkyd67S5L.lore3:
**BATTLE OF SHADY WOODS**

The situation between the elves and the dwarves had been brewing for many years, as both lived around the eastern reaches of Haqor Bay. The elves had established a colony–named Shady Woods–in the woods near some dwarven mines. The two races regularly bickered and engaged in border skirmishes. Rumors circulated that the elves were establishing their own mines and stealing the dwarves' resources. The matter came to a head when the elves dammed and redirected the flow of a river to provide water to their colony. This caused a major uproar among the dwarves, who ordered a meeting with the elves to set out a list of formal demands. However, before the meeting took place an unknown saboteur damaged the dam and redirected the water into the dwarven mines. Many dwarven lives were lost in the resulting floods. The dwarves blamed the elves and claimed it was an act of war. They invaded the elven colony of Shady Woods, killing thousands of elves. The slaughter included defenseless men, women, and children–solely intended to cripple all hope of the elves’ survival there. The remaining elves–and the elves in the surrounding areas–were forced to retreat deep into the Fayhelm forests, where they remain to this day.

rec3tQoeVsZ0xETNI.name: Human
rec3tQoeVsZ0xETNI.shortDescription: Perhaps the most diverse and adaptable race, humans vary heavily in their physical appearances
rec3tQoeVsZ0xETNI.description: Perhaps the most diverse and adaptable race, humans vary heavily in their physical appearances. Although humans lack innate magic or other special characteristics, they make up for it through their natural curiosity and ability to master nearly any craft with the right amount of dedication. Humans differ as much in mannerisms as they do appearance. Some are trustworthy, some deceitful. Some have pleasant dispositions, others are downright nasty. Some are rich, some are poor. Some live by strict moral codes, while others discard the idea of rightness entirely. At the end of the day humans are human, with all their flaws and strengths.
rec3tQoeVsZ0xETNI.lore2:
**SO MUCH TO DO, SO LITTLE TIME**

Though many things can be said of humans, a lack of ambition is not one of them. The shortest-lived of all races on Haerra, humans are often driven to eternalize their brief lives in the annals of history. Whether seeking fame, fortune, fulfillment, or knowledge; humans embody ambition and passionate curiosity in everything they do. Some engage in politics and philosophy, exercising their charisma and intellect to incredible lengths. Others are possessed by dreams of domination: mastering sword, sorcery, and slave to gain supremacy. Humans who would do anything for the admiration and respect of their peers neighbor others who thrive on fear and pain. Though the goals of humans vary and conflict, they share a common zeal to make the most of their fleeting existence.
rec3tQoeVsZ0xETNI.lore3:
**EXPANSION AND CONQUEST**

Many elves only have two children within the span of five hundred years. Dragonkin reproduce rarely, if at all. Humans, on the other hand, expand at a much faster rate. Some Haerran humans have over fifteen children in their lifetime, though the average is closer to three. Such incredible population growth creates several issues that humans must contend with. For one, a family of six humans over a hundred years requires far more food than a timeless elven family of three. As a result, humans spend much of their time and resources finding more food, expanding their borders, and–well–reproducing. But when resources are scarce, humans often turn to in-fighting; from roving bandits to wars of disastrous scales. As they expand, humans also pick fights with other peoples, driving them from their homes with sheer advantage in numbers. Just like other races, humans are learning to temper their instincts as they grow and change–working with their fellow people to create a better Haerra for all.

recCASQHQIE8ZhyXB.name: Demonkin
recCASQHQIE8ZhyXB.shortDescription: Though not always associated with evil, the demonkin's curved horns and chromatic skin tones certainly stand out from other humanoids.
recCASQHQIE8ZhyXB.description: Demonkin appear similar to humans in size and build, but their curling horns, vibrant chromatic skin (usually of red, blue, or purple), and hooked tails sets demonkin drastically apart from their human counterparts. However in order to remain undetected many demonkin undergo the painful process of cutting off their horns to appear more human-like. Though their exact origin is unknown, many believe that demonkin stem from a union between a powerful witch and a chaospawn of Azorag who found his way into Haerra. Demonkin are capable of casting a number of innate low grade spells and incantations. They are also well versed in the use of swords and crossbows. Feared by many on Haerra, the skill of the demonkin combined with their intellect make them dangerous foes.
recCASQHQIE8ZhyXB.lore2:
**A PROUD PEOPLE BETRAYED**

Once, demonkin lived side-by-side with other humanoids. Made prosperous by the rolling fields and forests that once covered modern-day Valburn, the demonkin built great cities and places of learning. Little prejudice existed against the demonkin, though some found their appearance unnatural. But when volcanic ash filled the air–residue of the cataclysmic Magocracy Wars–and Valburn’s Long Night began, demonkin died in droves. Those that survived would see their farms and livestock wilted by heat and scourged by flames, buried in ash and snow as the sunlight was consumed by black smoke. When the dust settled, no Haerran peoples dared to aid the demonkin, for doing so would acknowledge the wrongdoing of the most powerful wizards in Haerra. To mask the truth, enticing stories and rumors spread of the demonkin’s great sins and eventual reckoning: punished by the gods for their hubris. Demonkin became the subjects of cautionary children’s stories, and their demonic appearance gained association with evil and tyranny. As the demonkin were forced to scrape by for survival, engaging in banditry, piracy, and tribal raids; this stereotype only grew stronger.
recCASQHQIE8ZhyXB.lore3:
**BLOODLINE AND STATION**

Family and duty are the most important things in demonkin society, and everything revolves around these two things. The family structure determines one's duties in the household, led primarily by a matriarch (the eldest woman in the family). A person’s role in society is tied to their bloodline: a family of soldiers will always be a family of soldiers. These roles are so strongly entrenched that they survived even Valburn’s Long Night–into their tribal era–and still pervade the Valburn Empire today. Beyond their family and occupation ties, demonkin society is divided into two main castes: the Corruptors and the ‘lesser’ demonkin. Corruptors visually resemble their brethren, but with larger horns and thicker, carapace-like skin. Their innate magical abilities are also much stronger than regular demonkin. Historically, Corruptor families have always held the upper hand over other demonkin, using their natural advantages to enforce their superiority. Though the castes are not as defined as they used to be, the Valburn Empire is still governed by Corruptors, though lesser demonkin are allowed some positions of power.

rec0kh8fTt2cv6A2n.name: Dragonkin
rec0kh8fTt2cv6A2n.shortDescription: These towering humanoids heavily resemble a wingless version of their namesake: from the multicolored scales to their lizard-like head and appendages.
rec0kh8fTt2cv6A2n.description: It is the common belief that the dragonkin are from another planet. They are not. They are from another time. By some natural quirk that caused a rip in the time matrix some of these creatures slipped into the modern world of Haerra and cannot return. They stand seven feet tall and are similar in looks to giant lizards with tails and claws on their hands and feet. Each side in the battle between Heaven and Hell believes that the dragonkin are on their side, and each side is wrong. The dragonkin are observers and just seek a way to return to their own time and place. They only become involved if they feel they are being threatened.
rec0kh8fTt2cv6A2n.lore2:
**DRAGONKIN AND DRAGONS**

No one knows the exact origins of the dragonkin. Some scholars believe it to be the result of a union between a human and a dragon, while others theorize it to be the result of foul magic: be it of draconic or humanoid origin. No matter the source, many dragonkin despise their draconic ancestors rather than revering them. Much of this can be traced to a red dragon named Velzedir, who enslaved the small dragonkin population as minions and playthings for centuries. Kadduk the Divine Dagger–perhaps the most heroic figure in dragonkin history–supposedly slayed Velzedir single handedly with nothing but a rusted dagger. Kadduk became the first independent leader of the dragonkin in centuries, and he mandated a fervent hate of dragons–a hate that remains to this day.
rec0kh8fTt2cv6A2n.lore3:
**TIME-LOCKED**

Dragonkin only surfaced in Haerra recently, in the last two centuries of the Illumination. Before that, dragonkin had only been told of in stories and shoddy historical documents. Though many on Haerra presume the dragonkin were simply in isolation for a millennium, the reality is much stranger. During the Dawning era, long after Kadduk the Divine Dagger had slain their dragon oppressor Velzedir, a dragonkin tribe encountered a mystical ripple in the fabric of time. Unknowing and curious, the dragonkin ventured into the ripples in the air, and emerged into a futuristic Haerra, where humanoids had built sprawling civilizations and their dragon enemies had fallen into obscurity. However, as they entered into this seemingly utopian paradise, they found themselves rejected by the greater populace of Haerra. Spurned and defeated, the dragonkin returned to the mountains only to find that the ripple in time had closed. They were trapped in modern Haerra. They founded the reclusive Dragonhollow and began to research ways to return home. While many dragonkin cling to the past and remain spiteful of the Haerran population, others set out to make a life in Haerra, hoping to change the minds of those around them.

recEBupfqA3dZJtxl.name: Alorium
recEBupfqA3dZJtxl.shortDescription: Chief among Eledon's people, the alorium help Eledon rule his realm, train his troops, and enforce his rule.
recEBupfqA3dZJtxl.description: Astralytes of incredible power, these select few servants of Eledon have mastered themselves, the principles of Eledon, and astra energy itself. Now they aid Eledon in the governance of his empire: overseeing the training of his soldiers and clergy, issuing judgement in trials and ensuring his laws are upheld.

recNQ8aWTgu0GYBOF.name: Astralyte
recNQ8aWTgu0GYBOF.shortDescription: From feather-winged humanoids to gold-furred griffons, astralytes of all types populate Eledon's realm and fill the ranks of his army.
recNQ8aWTgu0GYBOF.description: The celestial beings known as astralytes are servants of Eledon, and denote all those under his dominion. Although typically thought of as beautiful humanoids with white feathered wings, astralytes take a variety of forms, from humanoid to beast-like and many without any wings at all. All astralytes swear allegiance to Eledon, and few who dared to break that oath live to tell the tale.

recZ5a1h1QYk39NWh.name: Demorium
recZ5a1h1QYk39NWh.shortDescription: Chief among Azorag's people, the demorium help Azorag oversee his realm, train his troops, and enforce his rule.
recZ5a1h1QYk39NWh.description: Demorium are the most vicious and powerful chaospawn in Azorag's realm. With an unfaltering thirst for chaos, these few individuals have been handpicked by Azorag to help him oversee his nation, lead his soldiers, and corrupt his foes through fear or lust.

reczinyGj8vbCyC6O.name: Chaospawn
reczinyGj8vbCyC6O.shortDescription: From leather-winged gargoyles to seductive succubi, chaospawn of all types populate Azorag's realm and fill the ranks of his army.
reczinyGj8vbCyC6O.description: From horrifying to irresistibly beautiful, chaospawn adopt many forms depending on their origin. No matter their appearance, however, they all swear allegiance to Azorag and the consuming power of chaos. Some chaospawn are born--like the succubi--while others are created: tortured creatures of stitched skin and limb. Though few types of chaospawn share similar characteristics, they all have a common thirst for destruction and blood.

reczRDMS9QmA6ExB6.name: God
reczRDMS9QmA6ExB6.shortDescription: Though perspectives differ on what constitutes a god, these beings are undeniably powerful, with incredible control over the various energies.
reczRDMS9QmA6ExB6.description: Beings of remarkable power, the gods mastered the energies, transcended into the cube, and survived the collapse of eleven universes. Now they influence the people of Haerra, gathering followers and orchestrating a release from their cubic prison. What this would mean for the people of Haerra: none truly understand--not even the gods.

recOG5Hk7pyXdmHua.name: The Archons
recOG5Hk7pyXdmHua.shortDescription: The Archons are devout followers of Eledon and wielders of astra energy.
recOG5Hk7pyXdmHua.description: The Archons are devout followers of Eledon and wielders of astra energy.
recOG5Hk7pyXdmHua.lore1: The Archons, devout followers of Eledon, believe themselves to be ‘human alorium’ (that is, the highest class of humanity). They emulate their angelic god; dressing in white robes with gold embroidery and embellishments. Archons generally see the population of Haerra as below them, and few Archons leave the islands save for a number of priests who travel across Haerra to spread the gospel of Eledon. They are devoted to their cause and are very resistant to being diverted from what they believe is their true calling.
recOG5Hk7pyXdmHua.lore2:
**BELIEFS**

1. Eledon's glory will liberate the world from its many evils.
2. To live a fulfilled and good life is to aspire, in all things, to become more like Eledon.
3. Anything that opposes the doctrine of Eledon is evil, and evil must be eradicated wherever it exists.
recOG5Hk7pyXdmHua.lore3:
**GOALS**

To spread the dictates of Eledon across Haerra and to release Eledon from his cubic prison. To seek out and destroy evil wherever it can be found. To perfect oneself by striving towards the principles of Eledon.
recOG5Hk7pyXdmHua.lore4:
**HISTORY**

The Archons were founded over two-hundred years ago, when an Elysium mage named Tabila Lio found an old cache of texts said to be the doctrines of Eledon. Tabila scoured these texts for some time, though she claimed her motivations were impure: searching for arcane power instead of "Eledon's light." What she found, however, was a persuasive religious doctrine, which she then spread among her circles. She spoke of order amidst destruction and purity that could perfect one's soul.

Over time, she gathered a large following among the mages. This worried many other mages, who saw their arcane innovation threatened by the strict edicts of Eledon. In response, the mages turned against the self-proclaimed 'Archons' and exiled them from the islands.

Tabila and her followers left peacefully, bent on finding a place to practice without the meddling of others in Haerra. The Archons vanished to the islands south of Ashyrah, where they began to build their metropolis: the Archon Citadel. Although it took many years and an incredible amount of magic, the Archons finally completed the Citadel and occupied it alongside their devout followers. The original mages became the first council of Seraphim, giving up their mana-based powers in favor of practicing the Astra energy taught to them by the holy texts. Ever since then, the Archons have been practicing and spreading the gospel of Eledon across Haerra.

rec7Y7OTRixxOiQFY.name: Desert Virans
rec7Y7OTRixxOiQFY.shortDescription: Both a race and a civilization, the Desert Virans perfect the art of crafting and set the gold standard for guild organization.
rec7Y7OTRixxOiQFY.description: Both a race and a civilization, the Desert Virans perfect the art of crafting and set the gold standard for guild organization.
rec7Y7OTRixxOiQFY.lore1: While the vira’s Desert Kilran cousins focus their creativity on chaotic mechanical contraptions and alchemical reactions, the vira prefer to channel their energy into more refined forms of crafting. Any such crafting heavily involves the Guilds. Much of vira society is ordered around the Guilds, which are regarded with near-religious reverence by many vira. Guild membership is determined by birth, and many families have remained in the same discipline for centuries. Certain guilds, such as the Architects Guild, are renowned above others; creating a quasi-caste system that changes depending on which guilds are high in demand.
rec7Y7OTRixxOiQFY.lore2:
**BELIEFS**

1. Organization is the key to a thriving people. Without organization, the world would fall into disarray.
2. Guilds are the best tool for societal organization, and must always be preserved and improved upon.
3. Creativity is a civil and gradual thing that requires controlled experimentation, meticulous record-keeping, and finesse.
rec7Y7OTRixxOiQFY.lore3:
**GOALS**

To craft marvelous and practical inventions to solve Haerra's issues. To bring order and 'high society' to the world through the use of civic guilds. To move Haerra beyond its foolish wars and bickering, into an era of refined science and prosperity.
rec7Y7OTRixxOiQFY.lore4:
**HISTORY**

Since their inception, the vira have always been a people of the desert. Their small size addresses many of the desert's challenges, since their bodies generate less heat and require less food than many other humanoids. Paired with their unique ingenuity and artifice abilities, the desert makes a natural home and defense for the vira.

As the vira grew in both population and reputation, they progressed technologically--harnessing the sun through complex contraptions using kona energy--and administratively--setting the Haerran standard for banking and trade. When a major divide in priorities and philosophy led to a split between virans and kilrans, the remaining vira focused their energy on building specialized guilds and work programs. The result was an efficiency machine of a society, with all its upsides and flaws.

recTj8e2uDwcx3M5K.name: Desert Kilrans
recTj8e2uDwcx3M5K.shortDescription: Cousins to the Vira, the Kilrans focus their talents on unrestrained alchemical experiments and radical creativity.
recTj8e2uDwcx3M5K.description: Cousins to the Vira, the Kilrans focus their talents on unrestrained alchemical experiments and radical creativity.
recTj8e2uDwcx3M5K.lore1: Just like their vira cousins, the kilrans pride themselves on curiosity and ingenuity. While the vira are a shade more reserved in their creation, the kilrans pursue progress unbridled by restraint. Explosions frequently rock their towns and cities, constructs come to life and wreak havoc, and rarely-tested airships lose control and crash into towers that are resurrected two to three times a year. But with such risk comes great reward, and the kilrans exemplify this above all others: embracing the chaos to generate incredible innovations like sentient constructs and working mechanical wings.
recTj8e2uDwcx3M5K.lore2:
**BELIEFS**

1. Useless checks and balances should not get in the way of scientific progress and ingenuity.
2. Invention is a thing of adventure and passion, and projects should not be assigned by birth or station.
3. Organization and record-keeping are tools for the weak-minded.
recTj8e2uDwcx3M5K.lore3:
**GOALS**

To create incredible things without reservation. To free Haerra from its preoccupations with order, control, and birth mandates. To bring adventure and playfulness to science, invention, and the overall future of Haerra.
recTj8e2uDwcx3M5K.lore4:
**HISTORY**

Though the Archivist's calendar places the kilran's split from the vira sometime around 250 R.H., the kilran's dissatisfaction with their cousins stretches much further back.  According to vira lore, the name 'kilran' stems from an ancient instance where a reckless scientist killed a great many vira with an awry experiment. He was referred to in the trial as a 'kil-e-viran' or 'killer of virans'. The name stuck, and vira who went too far in the name of science were labeled "kilrans."

Over time, however, the kilrans came to embrace it. They thought that the benefits of unbridled experimentation outweighed the downsides. According to kilran scholars, one kilran even remarked: "they call us killers of our own people, but by suppressing talent and creativity they are the real killers of virans." After a great deal of strife and in-fighting, the kilrans eventually organized a self-imposed exodus, leaving Qiddir Desert for the harsher deserts across the Bronze Sierras. The kilrans settled the sandy expanses of the Copper Desert, creating a central place of trade where modern-day Tabr now sits.

recyOKyFXjsUfeJZI.name: Fayhelm Druids
recyOKyFXjsUfeJZI.shortDescription: The Fayhelm Druids are expert uses of gaia energy and strive to become one with nature.
recyOKyFXjsUfeJZI.description: The Fayhelm Druids are expert uses of gaia energy and strive to become one with nature.
recyOKyFXjsUfeJZI.lore1: The tribes of the Fayhelm Druids are scattered across the forests of Fayhelm,  tending to create habitations high in the tree canopies, with walkways connecting their different living areas. The largest tribe of druids--the Tribe of the Great Faytree--dwell in the roots and branches of the massive Faytree. They use earth magic and are attuned with nature and the seasons. They look like humans with a silvery-green sheen to their skin, however, their attunement with nature sometimes gives rise to strange physical characteristics, like antlers and goat legs. They are longer-lived than humans, the eldest being over one hundred and fifty years of age. They generally avoid outsiders, although they have a passable relationship with the elves. Regardless of this isolation, druids will take in any lost or damaged souls who come searching for protection or healing--physical or otherwise.
recyOKyFXjsUfeJZI.lore2:
**BELIEFS**

1. There is a natural order to things, and this order must be revered and protected.
2. Humanoids disrupt the natural order with their wanton and destructive behaviors.
3. A scourge is sometimes necessary to maintain the natural order.
recyOKyFXjsUfeJZI.lore3:
**GOALS**

To watch over and protect the earth and its inhabitants from destruction. To heal the wounded and care for the ill, especially if they cannot help themselves. To maintain the natural balance and prevent humanoids from disrupting the cycle of life.
recyOKyFXjsUfeJZI.lore4:
**HISTORY**

The Fayhelm Druids have protected and dwelt within the Fayhelm forests for as long as humanoids have existed on Haerra. Traditionally isolated and more at home with nature than 'civilization', the druids had little contact with the other peoples of Haerra until recently. There are many ancient tall tales about the druids and hermits living within the Fayhelm forests, though most are more fiction than fact.

The actual history of the druids is vague at best, relying upon an oral history passed from generation to generation. Much of this is framed in stories, making druidic history entertaining, if not reliable.
